metadata.Title: CVE-2012-6153 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
http/conn/ssl/AbstractVerifier.java in Apache Commons HttpClient before 4.2.3 does not properly verify that the server hostname matches a domain name in the subject's Common Name (CN) or subjectAltName field of the X.509 certificate, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to spoof SSL servers via a certificate with a subject that specifies a common name in a field that is not the CN field.  NOTE: this issue exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2012-5783.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-6153` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libcommons-httpclient-java - 3.1-10.2
No subscription required

libhttpclient-java - 4.4.1-1
libhttpmime-java - 4.4.1-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> debian's 06_fix_CVE-2012-5783.patch already contains the fix for CVE-2012-6153

criterions.comment: commons-httpclient package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.1-10.2').
httpcomponents-client package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.1-1').
